Detailed Description

Packet for selecting Items, matching a specific search, from a set.

After the normal header the request packet contains: {tabular}{lll} { Name of field} & { Field size}& { Position} \ & & getHeaderEndPosition() \ nbr items & 4 bytes & +4 \ useString & 1 byte & +1 \ nbrSortedHits & 1 byte & +1 \ categoryType & 2 bytes & +2 \ matchType & 4 bytes & +4 \ stringPart & 4 bytes & +4 \ length of searchString& 4 bytes & +4 \ proximityItems & 4 bytes & +4 \ requestedLanguage & 4 bytes & +4 \ regionsInMatches & 4 bytes & +4 \ maxNbrHits & 2 bytes & +2 \ searchString & strlen(s)+1 & +strlen(s)+1 {tabular}

Definition at line 364 of file ServerProximityPackets.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ProximitySearchRequestPacket::ProximitySearchRequestPacket (  uint16  packetID,
uint16  reqID,
uint32  mapID
) 
 

Packet for finding relevant matches from a set of Items.

Parameters:
packetID ID of this packet.
reqID ID of the request that created this packet, and that will receive the answer.
mapID ID of the map where the items in this packet are located.

Member Function Documentation

bool ProximitySearchRequestPacket::addItem (  uint32  itemID,
int &  position
) 
 

Add an item to the packet.

The field that stores the number of items is increased by one. The last parameter must be initialized with a call to getFirstItemPosition().

See also:
getItem() Example of usage of getFirstItemPosition().
Returns:
true if the item was added, false if packet was full.

void ProximitySearchRequestPacket::encodeRequest (  uint8  dbMask,
proximitySearchItemsType  proximityItems,
uint16  maximumNumberHits,
bool  useString,
const char *  searchString,

StringTable::languageCode  requestedLanguage,
uint32  regionsInMatches
)  [inline]
 

Same as above, but without default values and with StringTable::languageCode.

The languageCode will be translated into the right kind of code. (Which is really is language_t).

Put information into the packet.

Parameters:
proximityItems The type of search.
maximumNbrHits The maximum number of hits that will be returned.
useString True if the searchString should be used to limit search hits.
See also:
VanillaSearchRequestPacket

int ProximitySearchRequestPacket::getFirstItemPosition (   ) 
 

Returns the position of the first item.

Used to initalize the parameter in getItem and addItem.

Returns:
The position of the first item in this packet.

uint32 ProximitySearchRequestPacket::getItem (  int &  position  ) 
 

Get the next item.

The parameter must be initialized with a call to getFirstItemPosition()#. An example of usage is: {verbatim} int pos = p->getFirstItemPosition(); uint32 n = p->getNbrItems(); for (uint32 i=0; i<n; << i++) cerr << i << " itemID = " << getItem(pos) << endl; {verbatim}

See also:
getNbrItems Observe the comment about this expensive call.
Returns:
The ID of the next item.

uint32 ProximitySearchRequestPacket::getNbrItems (   ) 
 

Get the amount of items in the packet.

{ { NB!} This call is quite expensive (since the position of this attribute not is constant but must be calculated each time).}

Returns:
The number of items that is added to this packet.
